oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Louise Scruggs Memorial Forum - Cindy Mabe - 2018-02-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The 11th Annual Louise Scruggs Memorial Forum honoring Cindy Mabe from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 21, 2018. Hosted by Abi Tapia. Includes audio from video and excerpts of recorded audio.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cindy Mabe;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music and audio from video of Universal Music highlights / (05:06) Opening comments and introduction of Cindy Mabe by Lisa Purcell / (09:04) Introduction of Gary Scruggs and previous Louise Scruggs honorees in attendance including Kay Clary, Bonnie Gardner, Sarah Trahern, Liz Thiels and Nancy Shapiro / (09:40) Introduction of Gibson President David Berryman / (10:37) Comments from Berryman / (12:49) Introduction of Cindy Mabe by Abi Tapia / (14:28) Cindy's opening comments / (14:54) Cindy talks about first working with Carrie Underwood and her early days of stardom / (18:54) Talk about Carrie signing with Capitol records and working with her again / (19:46) Plays audio excerpt of Jesus Take The Wheel and The Champion / (22:10) Cindy talks about the previously played songs / (22:42) Talks about her background and growing up / (24:00) Cindy talks about being the only girl on her childhood baseball team /

(25:36) Learning the life lesson of what if feels like to sit on the sidelines / (26:07) Playing softball through high school / (26:46) Talks about her career ambitions when she was young / (27:21) Working as an intern for R. J. Reynolds tobacco company / (28:13) Studying marketing at the University of North Carolina and having 5 different jobs over a summer / (29:09) Making of list of her passions and visiting Nashville during Fan Fair / (30:08) Talking to a radio station WTQR executive about jobs in the music business and deciding to come to Nashville to attend Belmont University / (32:15) Talks about Belmont University's intern program / (32:56) Talks about her first internship at Arista Records in the publicity department / (33:55) Talk about her second internship in marketing at RCA Records and first hearing about Joe Galante / (34:50) Talks about working with Joe Galante /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mabe, Cindy; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
